description:
OUT.SPINE.PK | Primary identity for Outreach. All sub-hubs FK to this.
Minted when company passes CL identity gate (identity_status = PASS).

OUT.SPINE.FK | Receipt back to cl.company_identity.company_unique_id.
Sub-hubs do NOT see this - they only use outreach_id.
ON DELETE RESTRICT - cannot delete CL identity if Outreach exists.

OUT.SPINE.DOMAIN | Company domain, denormalized from CL for query performance.
        Company Target reads this - it NEVER touches CL tables directly.
Flag indicating we have a historical appointment/meeting with this company. TRUE = warm/lukewarm outreach, FALSE = cold outreach
UUID primary key for outreach company target record
FK to cl.company_identity - parent hub identity
Current outreach status: not_started, active, paused, completed, do_not_contact
Cached BIT score at time of targeting (0-100)
Timestamp when company was first added to outreach
Timestamp of most recent outreach activity
Number of sequences this company has been through
Currently active sequence identifier
Origin of this target record (e.g., manual, import, bit_trigger)
Record creation timestamp
Last modification timestamp

OUT.TARGET.FK | Foreign key to outreach.outreach.outreach_id.
This is the ONLY FK sub-hubs use. They do NOT directly access sovereign_id.

BLOG.ENUM.FK | Typed source classification. Replaces source_type TEXT.
Valid: website, blog, press, news, filing, careers.
FORBIDDEN: social (blocked by doctrine guard).
UUID primary key for person contact record
FK to outreach.company_target
Denormalized FK to cl.company_identity for fast queries
Executive slot assignment: CHRO, HR, Benefits, CFO, CEO
Primary email address (validated)
Boolean flag indicating email verification status
Timestamp of last successful email verification
Current contact status: active, bounced, unsubscribed, do_not_contact
Lifecycle stage: suspect, prospect, mql, sql, customer, churned
Funnel position: top, middle, bottom, closed_won, closed_lost
Cumulative count of email opens
Cumulative count of email link clicks
Cumulative count of email replies
Current BIT score for this person (0-100)
Timestamp of most recent engagement event
Timestamp of last lifecycle state transition
Origin of this person record (e.g., linkedin, import, enrichment)
Record creation timestamp
Last modification timestamp

OUT.PEOPLE.FK | Foreign key to outreach.outreach.outreach_id.
Denormalized for query performance. Must match target.outreach_id.
Barton ID format: 04.04.02.XX.XXXXX.XXX (immutable during promotion)
Reference to parent company Barton ID
Reference to company slot Barton ID
Timestamp when record was promoted from people_raw_intake
Reference to the audit log entry for this promotion
Tracks whether the email address has been verified (e.g., via bounce check, MX record, API validation). Default: false
References message_key_reference for next scheduled message. Format: MSG.ROLE.TYPE.VERSION
Source of email verification: apollo, millionverifier, zerobounce, manual, etc.
Timestamp when email was last verified. Used for re-verification scheduling (30-day refresh).
HC_ID: Primary key, auto-generated sequential ID. Format: auto-increment. Example: 12345
HC_DOMAIN: Company website domain - primary identifier. Format: lowercase, no protocol. Example: acme.com
HC_ORG_NAME: Legal or common company name from Hunter. Format: title case. Example: Acme Corporation
HC_HEADCOUNT_RAW: Employee count range as string. Format: range format: X-Y. Example: 51-200
HC_COUNTRY: Two-letter country code. Format: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2. Example: US
HC_STATE: State/province/region. Format: US state abbreviation or full name. Example: PA
HC_CITY: City name. Format: title case. Example: Pittsburgh
HC_POSTAL: ZIP or postal code. Format: varies by country. Example: 15213
HC_STREET: Street address line. Format: street address format. Example: 123 Main St
HC_EMAIL_PATTERN: Email pattern for generating addresses. Format: {first}.{last} format. Example: {first}.{last}
HC_COMPANY_TYPE: Company ownership type. Format: Hunter classification. Example: privately held
HC_INDUSTRY: Industry classification from Hunter. Format: Hunter industry taxonomy. Example: Construction
HC_ENRICHED_TS: When Hunter data was fetched. Format: ISO 8601. Example: 2026-02-03T12:00:00Z
HC_CREATED_TS: Record creation timestamp. Format: ISO 8601. Example: 2026-02-03T12:00:00Z
HC_UPDATED_TS: Last update timestamp. Format: ISO 8601. Example: 2026-02-03T12:00:00Z
HC_EMBEDDING: Semantic embedding for similarity search. Format: OpenAI ada-002 format. Example: [0.1, 0.2, ...]
HC_INDUSTRY_NORM: Cleaned/mapped industry category. Format: standardized taxonomy. Example: Construction
HC_HEADCOUNT_MIN: Minimum employee count from range. Format: positive integer. Example: 51
HC_HEADCOUNT_MAX: Maximum employee count from range. Format: positive integer. Example: 200
HC_LOCATION_FULL: Full address string for display. Format: concatenated address. Example: 123 Main St, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, US
HC_QUALITY: Composite data completeness score. Format: 0.00 to 1.00. Example: 0.85
HC_TAGS: Custom classification tags. Format: array of strings. Example: ["target", "priority"]
HC_SOURCE: Data source system. Format: source identifier. Example: hunter
HC_CT_ID: Link to company_target.company_unique_id. Format: UUID format. Example: a1b2c3d4-...
HC_OUTREACH_ID: Link to outreach.outreach.outreach_id. Format: UUID format. Example: a1b2c3d4-...
HCT_ID: Primary key, auto-generated sequential ID. Format: auto-increment. Example: 12345
HCT_DOMAIN: Company domain this contact belongs to. Format: lowercase, no protocol. Example: acme.com
HCT_EMAIL: Verified email address from Hunter. Format: valid email format. Example: john.smith@acme.com
HCT_FIRST_NAME: Contact first name. Format: title case. Example: John
HCT_LAST_NAME: Contact last name. Format: title case. Example: Smith
HCT_DEPT_RAW: Department from Hunter. Format: Hunter department taxonomy. Example: Executive
HCT_TITLE_RAW: Job title from Hunter. Format: free text. Example: Chief Executive Officer
HCT_POSITION_RAW: Full position description from source. Format: free text. Example: CEO and Founder
HCT_LINKEDIN: LinkedIn profile URL. Format: https://linkedin.com/in/.... Example: https://linkedin.com/in/johnsmith
HCT_TWITTER: Twitter/X handle. Format: @handle format. Example: @johnsmith
HCT_PHONE: Phone number if available. Format: E.164 or formatted. Example: +1-412-555-1234
HCT_CONFIDENCE: Hunter email confidence score. Format: 0-100. Example: 95
HCT_EMAIL_TYPE: Whether email is personal or generic. Format: personal|generic. Example: personal
HCT_NUM_SOURCES: Number of sources confirming this email. Format: positive integer. Example: 5
HCT_CREATED_TS: Record creation timestamp. Format: ISO 8601. Example: 2026-02-03T12:00:00Z
HCT_EMBEDDING: Semantic embedding for similarity search. Format: OpenAI ada-002 format. Example: [0.1, 0.2, ...]
HCT_TITLE_NORM: Normalized job title. Format: standardized title. Example: CEO
HCT_SENIORITY: Seniority classification. Format: enum: C-Level/Owner|VP|Director|Manager|Senior|Junior|Individual Contributor. Example: C-Level/Owner
HCT_DEPT_NORM: Normalized department. Format: standardized taxonomy. Example: Executive
HCT_IS_DM: Whether contact is a decision maker. Format: true/false. Example: true
HCT_FULL_NAME: Combined full name. Format: First Last format. Example: John Smith
HCT_EMAIL_VERIFIED: Hunter verification status. Format: true/false. Example: true
HCT_QUALITY: Composite data completeness score. Format: 0.00 to 1.00. Example: 0.92
HCT_PRIORITY: Computed outreach priority. Format: 1-5 (5=highest). Example: 5
HCT_TAGS: Custom classification tags. Format: array of strings. Example: ["hot-lead", "construction"]
HCT_SOURCE: Data source system. Format: source identifier. Example: hunter
HCT_CT_ID: Link to company_target.company_unique_id. Format: UUID format. Example: a1b2c3d4-...
HCT_OUTREACH_ID: Link to outreach.outreach.outreach_id. Format: UUID format. Example: a1b2c3d4-...
